item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by Daniel Patrick Moynihan
item.description: "To be Irish is to know that in the end the world will break your heart." -- Daniel Patrick Moynihan

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by Alex Levine
item.description: "Only Irish coffee provides in a single glass all four essential food groups: alcohol, caffeine, sugar and fat." -- Alex Levine

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by Sigmund Freud
item.description: "Where the questions of religion are concerned people are guilty of every possible kind of insincerity and intellectual misdemeanor." -- Sigmund Freud

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by Philippa Gregory
item.description: "...you have to have faith that you are doing God's will. Sometimes you will not understand. Sometimes you will doubt. But if you are doing God's will, you can't be wrong, you can't go wrong." -- Philippa Gregory

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by Katharine Hepburn
item.description: "If you always do what interests you, at least one person is pleased." -- Katharine Hepburn

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by Garth Stein
item.description:
"In Mongolia, when a dog dies, he is buried high in the hills so people cannot walk on his grave. The dog’s master whispers in the dog’s ear his wishes that the dog will return as a man in his next life. Then his tail is cut off and put beneath his head, and a piece of meat of fat is cut off and placed in his mouth to sustain his soul for its journey; before he is reincarnated, the dog’s soul is freed to travel the land, to run across the high desert plains for as long as it would like.
I learned that from a program on the National Geographic Channel, so I believe it is true. Not all dogs return as men, they say; only those who are ready.
I am ready." -- Garth Stein

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by Garth Stein
item.description: "Those monkey-thumbs were meant for dogs. Give me my thumbs, you fu**ing monkeys!" -- Garth Stein

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by J.R. Moehringer
item.description: "While I fear that we're drawn to what abandons us, and to what seems most likely to abandon us, in the end I believe we're defined by what embraces us." -- J.R. Moehringer

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "Chaos is more freedom; in fact, total freedom. But no meaning. I want to be free to act, and I also want my actions to mean something." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by Whitney Otto
item.description: "No one fights dirtier or more brutally than blood; only family knows it’s own weaknesses, the exact placement of the heart. The tragedy is that one can still live with the force of hatred, feel infuriated that once you are born to another, that kinship lasts through life and death, immutable, unchanging, no matter how great the misdeed or betrayal. Blood cannot be denied, and perhaps that’s why we fight tooth and claw, because we cannot—being only human—put asunder what God has joined together." -- Whitney Otto

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by Hakim Sanai
item.description: "This too shall pass." -- Hakim Sanai

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description:
"A man may die, nations may rise and fall, but an idea lives on. Ideas have endurance without death.
<i>[Remarks Recorded for the Opening of a USIA Transmitter, February 8 1963]</i>" -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "So comes snow after fire, and even dragons have their endings." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by T.F. Hodge
item.description: "Head up, heart open. To better days!" -- T.F. Hodge

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by Ludwig van Beethoven
item.description: "Music is like a dream. One that I cannot hear." -- Ludwig van Beethoven

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by Mary E. Pearson
item.description: "Sometimes there's not a better way. Sometimes there's only the hard way." -- Mary E. Pearson

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by William Beckett
item.description: "Hold your head high heavy heart." -- William Beckett

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by Annie Proulx
item.description: "We face up to awful things because we can't go around them, or forget them. The sooner you say 'Yes, it happened, and there's nothing I can do about it,' the sooner you can get on with your own life. You've got children to bring up. So you've got to get over it. What we have to get over, somehow we do. Even the worst things." -- Annie Proulx

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by Mark Haddon
item.description: "On the fifth day, which was a Sunday, it rained very hard. I like it when it rains hard. It sounds like white noise everywhere, which is like silence but not empty." -- Mark Haddon

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by Garth Stein
item.description: "There is no dishonor in losing the race. There is only dishonor in not racing because you are afraid to lose." -- Garth Stein

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by Richard Bandler
item.description: "The greatest personal limitation is to be found not in the things you want to do and can't, but in the things you've never considered doing." -- Richard Bandler

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Hope is a waking dream." -- Aristotle

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Determine that the thing can and shall be done and then... find the way." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Nancynoreen add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "You speak an infinite deal of nothing." -- William Shakespeare
